

# Ambiance Notes

- Make the Party feel like they are being watched

# First Draft

## Characters

- Leilock Gnolmes - English Accent 
	- Called to Investigate
		- Due to the precense of red
		- The discovery of one of the items that is a legendary item from the campaign
- Lando - Dutch Accent
	- Mayor and Sheriff of the Town
	- Things have been fine for months, don't know what changed now
	- 
- A.A. - Gruff Voice
	- In charge of the Dig Camps
	- Mining progress has been stopped early and the majority of the camps have left
- Sabine - Slightly European
	- Has a son - Silvester
- Sabine introduces them to the town
	- Tells them of each of the places and the structure
	- Mentions that Hoth & Wampa is expensive
	-

## Phase 1 Clues


Clue:
- There are Three Bodies and one Miner Missing
Source:
- A.A & Lando
How:
- They have been piling up, first it was the two friends who disappeared and then one of my trusted second in commands         just in the last night
- Another one of my second in commands who wen't to look is missing - **Krell**
When:
- In recent times, there seems to have been an uptick in the crazy
- My men reported weird shapes in the woods, dissonant cries, like they were being stalked at night
- Must be that cult in town
	- Lando calms him down


----------

Clue:
- Both Bodies mutilated beyond recognition
- Large Chunks of flesh are ripped out
- One has the vocal chords missing
- The other has large claw marks raking his body and his bones

	- Wren
	- Jarrus
How:
- Maybe in an interview with some people at the camp
- They were good folk, always too curios about what was deeper in Endora Woods and would try to sneak behind the locals back and go out in the dark at night
When:
Discovered two mornings ago

## First Battle Arc 

In the warehouse district

There is a single warehouse with light within

Inside there are figures in robes

With a figure in the middle prone and laying down

They are speaking a cant

Group has to make stealth rolls

Group can identify that it is Sabine in the center

They are found out

They fight the werewolves in the warehouse

[![Stalking Werewolf by mysteriouswhitewolf on DeviantArt](https://images-wixmp-ed30a86b8c4ca887773594c2.wixmp.com/f/3ba99212-ede4-4d25-a8dc-49bd18515815/dfbywk0-ea888172-7e0b-45ad-a823-5776c570e50a.jpg/v1/fill/w_1024,h_767,q_75,strp/stalking_werewolf_by_mysteriouswhitewolf_dfbywk0-fullview.jpg?token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..ylzeG4xpiAGsN8FJoAQ6YzvOfY_L7zjKNWLdVvvwZqA)![Stalking Werewolf by mysteriouswhitewolf on DeviantArt](data:image/jpeg;base64,)](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.deviantart.com%2Fmysteriouswhitewolf%2Fart%2FStalking-Werewolf-927096912&psig=AOvVaw1IwElQfc-hi5YTULQaZcsR&ust=1678137410453000&source=images&cd=vfe&ved=0CA8QjRxqFwoTCPit0JPbxf0CFQAAAAAdAAAAABAJ)

## Second Battle Arc

Battle against the Two Wendigo
One is invisible
One is visibile
They have changed depending on who they inhabited, i.e the races
Wearing a yellow gem embedded into their chests



## Final Reveal
- Hidden in the crypt underneath the passing stones
	- A coin with the sigil of a dragon on one side
	- A stanza of the Phoenix Saga
	- A single Jewel of Transcendence
		- Moonlight Gem



# Plot Planning


Takes Place in [[Beskarville]]

The party accompanies Sherleia Holmes to the town of Beskarville

A series of murders will unveil a local cult that offers sacrifices to the moongod Selune, one of the banished gods from the continent

They are using the hoax of a werewolf to drive off bandits and such

They polymorph/illusion wolves/use theatrics to scare
![[Eyes_PassingStars_Beskarville.jpg]]

However that does not answer some of the questions of the murder
- Strange visitors to the town before they came in
	- Both clothed in green and in yellow

Does not account for the murdered body in the woods
Does not account for a weird snarl in the woods

Within the Endor Woods, there is a ritual circle and reference to a legendary item discovered - In reference to Parila
![[Wendigo_EndoraWoods.png]]


There are signs of a Wendigo across the town as well
- Signs point to there being two Wendigo's 
- The party has to fight one Wendigo and another with Partial - Invisibility

In the final battle, to save one of the fallen adventurers, they are turned into a werewolf

We have werewolf vs wendigo showdown

Selune is the goddess who has been communicating to the wolves all these years.

She is part of a pact of gods outside of the Ader Vortex, who are nicknamed the Circling Few. 

She only has visual into this area, due to the mystical connection bewtween the werewolfs and here

There is only one true werewolf in the city and that is Selena, it is passed on from generation to generation. Makes her a priestess of Selune

Of the bodies discovered, we have wendo slash marks and large bite chunks taken off from the overall travelers

There are Order of the Red members who are also murdered 

Plotting two centroids we get the location in the Endora Woods

And Plotting the other centroid we get the location in the Passing Star Stones



Use a map to determine the centers of the activity

** Need a Town Map



We should use a map of the 


Steps of the Journey

- Come into Town
- Interview the locals and gather information
- Clues point to
	- Order of the Red PRecense
	- New Mythral being different than intended
	- Town has always been creepy and wolfy, but murders are new
	- Could be a scheme by Akbar to scare away people
		- He is acting suspicious
		- He has been coordinating with the order of the red
		- He sends his men to investigate and they are killed by the Wendigo
		- Signs of three Wendigo
		- The ORder of the Red thinks that the werewolf cult is on the enemy god's side
		- ORder of the red is trying to take down the werewolf cult
		- Second set of murders with different marks that point to the Passing Star Stones
		- They get clues of when the next rituals are for the passing star stones
		- The party ends up at the location of the passing star stones
		- Fight a Werewolf or two and then help the werewolfs fight the order of the red
		- They explain that they have only been killing order of the red people
		- Taking the centroids of the order of the red people out of the mix, the next location is a centroid of the Endora Woods
	- They then go to the location
	- First they must confront A. Akbar and he tells them of the whole conspiracy
	- But he saw one of the monsters and he needs to leave
	- They find evidence that there has been a ritual, that these creatures have come from the northern wastelands, and they also hate the order of the red
	- They gain insight into what the mysterious artifact they are guarding is
	- They then have to fight the wendigo



# Werewolf Statblocks
![[Normal_Werewolf Stats.png]]

![[Pureblood Werewolf Stats.png]]

# Wendigo StatBlock and Qualities

![[Wendigo Stat Block.png]]

Starvation and loneliness haunts the frozen north.

A wendigo resembles a cross between a human and a wolf, with massive antlers on its head and oversized, clawed hands. It walks upright or on all fours as its mood suits it. Upright it towers over the tallest man. It is thin, as if starving, with ash colored skin so thin that the skull and skeleton appear to push through in places. The eyes are sunken and glowing like hot coals. You will often smell a wendigo before seeing it.

-   **Isolation is death.** Wendigo prey on human's who have been weakened by starvation, cold, and isolation. Staying with a group is a good defense against them.
-   **Silent predator.** Wendigo can move swift and silent as the wind. They are incredible hunters in the remote wilderness where they dwell.
-   **Madness and mutation.** Humans can be transformed into Wendigo. They go insane during the process as the Wendigo brings them under their influence.
